description: X3DMaterial defines properties for surface geometry objects based on the material definitions from the X3D and COLLADA standards.

properties.name: shininess
properties.description: Specifies the sharpness of the specular highlight.

properties.name: transparency
properties.description: Specifies the degree of transparency of the surface geometry object.

properties.name: ambientIntensity
properties.description: Specifies the minimum percentage of diffuseColor that is visible regardless of light sources.

properties.name: specularColor
properties.description: Specifies the color of the light directly reflected by the surface geometry object.

properties.name: diffuseColor
properties.description: Specifies the color of the light diffusely reflected by the surface geometry object.

properties.name: emissiveColor
properties.description: Specifies the color of the light emitted by the surface geometry object.

properties.name: isSmooth
properties.description: Specifies which interpolation method is used for the shading of the surface geometry object. If the attribute is set to true, vertex normals should be used for shading (Gouraud shading). Otherwise, normals should be constant for a surface patch (flat shading).
